greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array:  T(n,k) = |round[(r^n)*(s^k)|, where r = golden ratio = (1+ sqrt(5))/2, s = (1 - sqrt(5))/2, 1 < = k <= n, n > = 0.
comment: Row n consists of the first n numbers of A169985 = (1,2,3,4,7,... ) in reverse order; these are the Lucas numbers, A000032, with order of initial two terms reversed.  Every column of the triangle is A169985.
link: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: T(n,k) = |round[(r^n)*(s^k)|, where r = golden ratio = (1+ sqrt(5))/2, s = (1 - sqrt(5))/2, 1 < = k <= n, n > = 0.
T(k+j-1,j) = A000032(k) = k-th Lucas number, for k >= 2.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, May 01 2016
